thread.title: Schools chief accused of barging into home may face charges - Education
thread.title_full: Schools chief accused of barging into home may face charges - Education

author: boston.com
title: Schools chief accused of barging into home may face charges - Education
text:
MASHPEE, Mass. (AP) — Police in Massachusetts are seeking to criminally charge the superintendent of a Cape Cod school district who’s accused of barging into a student’s home uninvited to see if she actually lived there.
Mashpee Police Chief Scott Carline says superintendent Brian Hyde faces charges of breaking and entering with intent to commit a misdemeanor and trespassing.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The police complaints now go before a clerk magistrate who will determine if charges are warranted.
Marilyn King, the mother of the student who attends Mashpee Middle-High School, says Hyde entered her home last month without permission, went upstairs and angrily demanded to know where her 17-year-old daughter slept. King says Hyde then rummaged through her daughter’s belongings.
Hyde has said he was invited into the home to do a routine residency check.
